At Fri, 14 Dec 2007 15:35:13 -0800,
Paul Jack <pjack@...> wrote:
> It's definitely a huge oversight that JMX can't do streaming
> operations -- the web UI can only edit 32K of seeds, for instance. I
> suppose we could try to extend JMX to allow streaming, but there's
> already a mountain of JMX support code in commons, and JMX is, alas,
> the standard.

Even more unfortunate, in my view, is that JMX can only interoperate
with Java solutions.

> Also for transferring large files like arcs or the crawl.log, you're
> better off using NFS/SMB. I wouldn't want to integrate a full WebDAV
> server (say) into Heritrix to enable arc removal; those kinds of
> tasks seem better suited to tools outside of Heritrix.

I’m pretty much agreed on this. I think that JMX will never be
sufficient for complete or near-complete solution for complete remote
control of heritrix (including delete of all information related to a
job, management of completed jobs, retrieval of logs & arcs, etc.);
but that’s just me. JMX + NFS/SMB work as well, of course.

> […]

best,
Erik Hetzner
;; Erik Hetzner, California Digital Library
;; gnupg key id: 1024D/01DB07E3
